database_info.name: Chinese Anti-Piracy Flotilla News Database
database_info.description: Test database containing news articles about Chinese naval vessels participating in anti-piracy operations

articles.title: 47th Chinese Naval Escort Task Force Conducts Multi-Subject Training in Gulf of Aden
articles.summary: China's 47th naval escort task force conducted extensive multi-subject training exercises in the Gulf of Aden, featuring the frigate CNS Honghe and supply ship CNS Gaoyouhu. The training focused on enhancing operational readiness amid increased regional security concerns in the Red Sea corridor.

location.description: Strategic maritime training area linking Red Sea with Arabian Sea

articles.regional_context: Increased Red Sea security concerns due to Houthi activities

articles.title: Chinese Destroyer CNS Baotou Arrives in Abu Dhabi for Replenishment Mission
articles.summary: The Type 052DL destroyer CNS Baotou, part of China's 47th naval escort task force, arrived in Abu Dhabi for a five-day replenishment and maintenance period. The 7,000-ton warship demonstrates China's expanding military reach in the Middle East region.

location.description: Strategic port visit in United Arab Emirates

vessels_mentioned.name: CNS Baotou
vessels_mentioned.role: Lead escort vessel with comprehensive combat capabilities

articles.capabilities: Anti-aircraft, anti-ship, and anti-submarine comprehensive combat capabilities

articles.title: Russia, China and Iranian Warships Conduct Joint Maritime Security Belt 2025 Drills
articles.summary: Ships from the Russian Navy, Chinese People's Liberation Army Navy, and Iranian Navy gathered at Iran's Chabahar Port for the Maritime Security Belt 2025 exercise. The Chinese vessels CNS Baotou and CNS Gaoyouhu participated in the multinational anti-piracy and maritime security drills.

location.description: Iranian naval base hosting multinational maritime exercise

articles.title: China's 47th Naval Escort Task Force Departs for Gulf of Aden Anti-Piracy Mission
articles.summary: The People's Liberation Army Navy's 47th Chinese Naval Escort Task Force, comprising destroyer CNS Baotou, frigate CNS Honghe, and replenishment ship CNS Gaoyouhu, departed from Zhoushan, Zhejiang Province for deployment to the Gulf of Aden and waters around Somalia.

location.region: Zhoushan Naval Base to Gulf of Aden
location.description: Deployment route from Chinese naval base to operational area

articles.mission_area: Gulf of Aden and waters around Somalia

articles.title: Chinese Navy's 46th Escort Task Force Completes 339-Day Deployment
articles.summary: The Chinese destroyer CNS Jiaozuo, frigate CNS Xuchang, and replenishment ship CNS Honghu completed their extended 339-day deployment, arriving at Zhanjiang naval port. The mission covered over 160,000 nautical miles with escort missions spanning Asia, Africa, and Europe.

location.description: Southern Chinese naval base in Guangdong Province

articles.title: US Ally Japan Sends Warship to Shadow Chinese Navy Task Force
articles.summary: Japan's Maritime Self-Defense Force dispatched a warship to monitor China's anti-piracy escort task force as it transited through the Miyako Strait. The incident highlights growing tensions over Chinese naval activities in international waters near Japanese territory.

location.description: Strategic waterway between Okinawa and Miyako Island

articles.title: Chinese Navy Escort Task Force Joins Multinational Anti-Piracy Operations
articles.summary: A new Chinese naval escort task force joined multinational anti-piracy operations in the Gulf of Aden, coordinating with international naval forces to protect commercial shipping. The mission demonstrates continued international cooperation in maritime security efforts.

location.region: Gulf of Aden Multinational Coordination Zone

articles.title: 43rd Chinese Navy Fleet Takes Over Gulf of Aden Escort Mission
articles.summary: The 43rd Chinese naval fleet, consisting of guided-missile destroyer Nanning, guided-missile frigate Sanya, and comprehensive supply ship Weishanhu, officially took over escort duties from the 42nd naval fleet. The handover included over 700 troops and two ship-borne helicopters.

location.region: Gulf of Aden Operational Handover Zone
location.description: Operational transition area for Chinese naval task forces

articles.title: Chinese Navy's 39th Escort Task Force Encounters Suspected Pirates
articles.summary: The 39th Chinese Naval Escort Task Force successfully deterred a suspected pirate speedboat while escorting eight Chinese fishing vessels through high-risk waters. The incident involved deployment of warning sirens, loudspeaker messages, and helicopter-borne special forces personnel.

location.region: Gulf of Aden High-Risk Transit Area
location.description: Known piracy-prone waters requiring enhanced security measures

vessels_mentioned.name: CNS Urumqi
vessels_mentioned.role: Task force flagship and piracy deterrent

articles.response_measures: Warning sirens, loudspeaker messages, helicopter deployment

articles.title: China Credits 45th Task Force with Completing 1,600th Escort Mission
articles.summary: China announced that the 45th naval escort task force completed the navy's 1,600th escort mission in the Gulf of Aden region since deployments began in 2008. The milestone demonstrates China's sustained commitment to international maritime security over 15 years of operations.

location.description: Historic milestone location for Chinese anti-piracy operations

articles.strategic_achievement: Long-term commitment to international maritime security

articles.title: Chinese Navy Conducts Advanced Anti-Piracy Drills in Gulf of Aden
articles.summary: China's 46th Escort Task Force intensively conducted specialized drills to enhance counter-terrorism, anti-piracy, armed rescue, and joint search and rescue capabilities. The exercise involved the guided-missile frigate Jiaozuo with air-sea coordination training and medical emergency simulations.

location.description: International waters off the coast of Yemen and Somalia

articles.title: Chinese Fishing Vessel Under Control of Alleged Pirates Off Somali Coast
articles.summary: A Chinese fishing vessel with up to 18 crew members has come under the control of alleged pirates off the Somali coast. The European Union anti-piracy force reported that some of the suspected pirates were armed with AK-47s and machine guns.

location.description: Waters off the eastern coast of Somalia

articles.threat_level: High - armed pirates with AK-47s and machine guns

articles.title: China, Russia and Iran Stage Navy Anti-Piracy Drills as Red Sea Attacks Escalate
articles.summary: China, Russia and Iran held a joint drill named 'Maritime Security Belt – 2024' from March 11-15 in the Gulf of Oman. The five-day exercise included training on firing at sea and rescue operations for hijacked merchant ships, with anti-piracy operations as a focus.

location.description: International waters in the Gulf of Oman, Indian Ocean

vessels_mentioned.name: Chinese naval vessels (specific names not disclosed)

articles.title: Four Years of Anti-Piracy Mission: Chinese Navy's Showcase Achievement
articles.summary: Analysis of China's four-year anti-piracy operations showcasing the strategic achievements and operational capabilities developed through sustained naval presence in the Gulf of Aden and surrounding waters.

location.region: Gulf of Aden & Horn of Africa
location.description: Strategic maritime corridor between Red Sea and Arabian Sea

articles.title: Chinese Navy Piracy Patrol Shepherds Fishing Fleet Through Gulf of Aden
articles.summary: Chinese Navy escort vessels successfully guided a fishing fleet through piracy-prone waters in the Gulf of Aden, demonstrating the ongoing protection provided to Chinese commercial vessels in the region.

location.description: International shipping lane through Gulf of Aden

vessels_mentioned.name: Chinese escort vessels (specific names not disclosed)

articles.title: Map Shows Chinese Navy Fleet's 300-Day Mission to Three Continents
articles.summary: Chinese Navy fleet completed an extensive 300-day deployment covering three continents, including anti-piracy operations in the Middle East, Asia, Africa, and Europe. The mission demonstrates China's expanding global naval reach.

location.description: Global deployment spanning Middle East, Asia, Africa, and Europe

articles.title: China's Anti-Piracy Flotillas: By the Numbers
articles.summary: Comprehensive analysis of China's anti-piracy operations showing statistical breakdown of missions, vessels deployed, and operational achievements since 2008. The study reveals the scale and impact of Chinese naval presence in counter-piracy efforts.

location.region: Gulf of Aden & Western Indian Ocean
location.description: Primary area of operations for Chinese anti-piracy flotillas

articles.title: Anti-Piracy Mission Helps China Develop Its Blue-Water Navy
articles.summary: Analysis of how China's sustained anti-piracy operations in the Gulf of Aden have contributed to the development of blue-water naval capabilities, including long-range logistics, power projection, and international cooperation skills.

location.description: Strategic waterway connecting Red Sea to Arabian Sea

vessels_mentioned.name: Various PLAN vessels
vessels_mentioned.type: Type 052D destroyers, Type 054A frigates, Type 903A supply ships

articles.operational_benefits: Long-range logistics and power projection experience

locations.name: Gulf of Aden
locations.description: Primary area of Chinese anti-piracy operations

locations.name: Somali Coast
locations.description: High-risk piracy area requiring naval protection

locations.name: Red Sea
locations.description: Extended area of Chinese maritime security operations
